meanings.definition: A liquid food made by boiling meat, fish, or vegetables in water.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a warm bowl of soop for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The chef prepared a delicious soop for the guests.
meanings.sent3: The soop was so hot, it steamed up my glasses!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up like a pot of soop on the stove.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the soop filled the kitchen, making my stomach growl.

meanings.definition: To eat or drink something quickly or eagerly.
meanings.sent1: He was so hungry that he decided to soop down his meal.
meanings.sent2: The kids always soop up their ice cream before it melts.
meanings.sent3: She sooped up the last bit of soup with her spoon.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to soop by as they enjoyed their meal together.
meanings.sent5: The dog sooped down his food in seconds, wagging his tail for more.

meanings.definition: To clean or wash something with water.
meanings.sent1: I need to soop the dishes before guests arrive.
meanings.sent2: She sooped the floor after the party to remove any spills.
meanings.sent3: He sooped the car, making it sparkle in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The rain came down hard, sooping away the dirt from the streets.
meanings.sent5: The waves crashed against the shore, sooping the sand clean with each retreat.
